instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3330-B No power (Intermitent Green Light)
threads.message:
Hello

-No turning on.
-Customer found signs of corrosion and cleaned the board. 
-Sometimes (1 of 10 times when I plug the PSU) I get green light for 2-3 seconds.
-Tried with another jack board and issue persisted. 

Measurements with no Green light: 
PP3V42_G3H: 3.4V
SMC_RESET_L: 3.37V
PPBUS_G3H: 12.50V
SMC_BC_ACOK: 3.26V
SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC: 3.40V
SYS_ONEWIRE: 3.40V
ADAPTER_SENSE:3.40V

Board takes 25mA from the PSU. Any idea? Thanks

threads.title: 820-3330-B No power (Intermitent Green Light)
threads.message:
Original 85W Magsafe charger?

I recommend to reball SMC.

threads.title: 820-3330-B No power (Intermitent Green Light)
threads.message:
Found a broken trace on U7201, fixed it and board turns on now.
But CPU voltages not present.

ALL_SYS_PWRGD: 3.3V

Could it be GPU related?

threads.title: 820-3330-B No power (Intermitent Green Light)
threads.message: R7403 was open, replaced but same problem.

threads.title: 820-3330-B No power (Intermitent Green Light)
threads.message:
I noticed that on the U7400 side of the R7403/02 I got 12V but only for 1 second. 
Replaced U7400 and same behaviour

threads.title: 820-3330-B No power (Intermitent Green Light)
threads.message:
TONA/B should drop to 0.5V approx, when CPU power supply works.
Be sure to have good solders and traces.
Also check all surrounding resistors and caps.
If all good, try known good BIOS.

threads.title: 820-3330-B No power (Intermitent Green Light)
threads.message: Could you provide good Bios file?

threads.title: 820-3330-B No power (Intermitent Green Light)
threads.message:
